Beginning of Imperial Decline

The decline of the Pratihara Empire began during the reign of Mahipala I. Although he managed to hold the empire for some time, he suffered a severe defeat at the hands of the Rashtrakuta king Indra III, who plundered Kannauj.

ЁЯМН
Arrival of Al-Masudi

The Baghdadi traveler Al-Masudi (915-916 CE) visited India during his reign. He referred to Mahipala as King 'Bauhura' (likely an alteration of 'Adivaraha') and described his vast army (especially the four armies: North, South, East, West).

ЁЯУЦ
Patronage of Rajashekhara

The poet Rajashekhara also stayed in his court and called Mahipala 'Maharajadhiraja of Aryavarta'.
